Class PanelPlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • PanelPlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PanelPlay
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The panel for the actual gameplay of JMania.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      The function that runs based on the timer.
      void addNote(int score)
      Adds an arrow's score to the total list of scores.
      int addnoteindex()
      A function that adds to the note index variable, in case variables must be static within a function.
      private void adjustSongVolume()
      Changes the song's volume (loudness) based on user-defined settings
      double calcAccuracy()
      Calculates the accuracy by dividing calcScore() by the maximum possible score (the amount of arrows multiplied by 3, as 3 is perfect).
      int calcScore()
      Calculates the score by finding the sum of the Judgement scores.
      private void endRound()
      Stops the game by ending the reading of the simfile and not reading the audio
      private void initProgressBar()
      Initializes the progress bar on the bottom of the screen, determining how far you have gotten in the song.
      private void initStatsLayout()
      Initializes the layout for the accuracy and score labels
      private void initTopLayout()
      Initializes the back button and judgement labels.
      int Judgement(Simfile sim, int notenum, int y)
      Determines how accurate the pressed arrow is compared to when it should be pressed (through y-coordinates of arrows).
      private void loadArrow(java.lang.String direction)
      Loads new arrows on the screen based on the direction that it should be in (which is passed into it).
      private void loadStaticSprites(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Loads images of arrows into ImageIcon variables and draws them on the screen.
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      The function that handles drawing the graphics on to the screen.
      void updateResults(int judge)
      Updates the judgement text, displaying whether the player got a perfect, great, good, or miss on the most recently pressed arrow.

    • Field Detail

      • arraySize

        private int arraySize
        The array size of the arrow coordinate arrays. Consequently, this is the max number of arrows which can be in a song.

      • width

        The dimensions of the panel as integers.

      • audioThread

        private java.lang.Thread audioThread
        The thread that plays the audio stream (music).

      • scores

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> scores
        A list of scores separated by each individual arrow. Stored as integers, such that 3 is perfect, 2 is great, 1 is good, and 0 is a miss.

        private long milltime
        A long value used to store the current time on the computer, to keep track of when to draw a frame. Used in conjunction with temptime to be updated when there is an adequate difference between the two.

        private long temptime
        A long value used to store the current time on the computer, to keep track of when to draw a frame. Used in conjunction with milltime to be updated until there is an adequate difference between the two.

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        The function that runs based on the timer. Graphics and music are mostly handled within this function.

      • loadStaticSprites

        private void loadStaticSprites(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Loads images of arrows into ImageIcon variables and draws them on the screen.

      • loadArrow

        private void loadArrow(java.lang.String direction)
        Loads new arrows on the screen based on the direction that it should be in (which is passed into it).

      • Judgement

        public int Judgement(Simfile sim,
                     int notenum,
                     int y)
        Determines how accurate the pressed arrow is compared to when it should be pressed (through y-coordinates of arrows). Returns 3 for perfect, 2 for great, 1 for good, and 0 for a miss.

      • calcScore

        public int calcScore()
        Calculates the score by finding the sum of the Judgement scores.

      • calcAccuracy

        public double calcAccuracy()
        Calculates the accuracy by dividing calcScore() by the maximum possible score (the amount of arrows multiplied by 3, as 3 is perfect). Returns a double which is a percentage.

      • addNote

        public void addNote(int score)
        Adds an arrow's score to the total list of scores.

      • updateResults

        public void updateResults(int judge)
        Updates the judgement text, displaying whether the player got a perfect, great, good, or miss on the most recently pressed arrow.
